trans-unit.source: Monitor service metrics
trans-unit.target: Monitor service metrics

trans-unit.source: Learn how to customize monitoring charts in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to customize monitoring charts in Azure.

trans-unit.source: All Azure services track key metrics that allow you to monitor the health, performance, availability and usage of your services.
trans-unit.target: All Azure services track key metrics that allow you to monitor the health, performance, availability and usage of your services.

trans-unit.source: You can view these metrics in the Azure portal, and you can also use the <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title> to access the full set of metrics programmatically.
trans-unit.target: You can view these metrics in the Azure portal, and you can also use the <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title> to access the full set of metrics programmatically.

trans-unit.source: For some services, you may need to turn on diagnostics in order to see any metrics.
trans-unit.target: For some services, you may need to turn on diagnostics in order to see any metrics.

trans-unit.source: For others, such as virtual machines, you will get a basic set of metrics, but need to enable the full set high-frequency metrics.
trans-unit.target: For others, such as virtual machines, you will get a basic set of metrics, but need to enable the full set high-frequency metrics.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Enable monitoring and diagnostics</linkText><title></title> to learn more.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Enable monitoring and diagnostics</linkText><title></title> to learn more.

trans-unit.source: You can chart any of the metrics them over any time period you choose.
trans-unit.target: You can chart any of the metrics them over any time period you choose.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Portal, click Browse, and then a resource you're interested in monitoring.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Portal, click Browse, and then a resource you're interested in monitoring.

trans-unit.source: The Monitoring section contains the most important metrics for each Azure resource.
trans-unit.target: The Monitoring section contains the most important metrics for each Azure resource.

trans-unit.source: For example, a web app has Requests and Errors, where as a virtual machine would have CPU percentage and Disk read and write: Monitoring lens
trans-unit.target: For example, a web app has Requests and Errors, where as a virtual machine would have CPU percentage and Disk read and write: Monitoring lens

trans-unit.source: Clicking on any chart will show you the Metric blade.
trans-unit.target: Clicking on any chart will show you the Metric blade.

trans-unit.source: On the blade, in addition to the graph, is a table that shows you aggregations of the metrics (such as average, minimum and maximum, over the time range you chose).
trans-unit.target: On the blade, in addition to the graph, is a table that shows you aggregations of the metrics (such as average, minimum and maximum, over the time range you chose).

trans-unit.source: Below that are the alert rules for the resource.
trans-unit.target: Below that are the alert rules for the resource.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Metric blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Metric blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To customize the lines that appear, click the Edit button on the chart, or, the Edit chart command on the Metric blade.
trans-unit.target: To customize the lines that appear, click the Edit button on the chart, or, the Edit chart command on the Metric blade.

trans-unit.source: On the Edit Query blade you can do three things:
trans-unit.target: On the Edit Query blade you can do three things:

trans-unit.source: Change the time range
trans-unit.target: Change the time range

trans-unit.source: Switch the appearance between Bar and Line
trans-unit.target: Switch the appearance between Bar and Line

trans-unit.source: Choose different metics <linkText>Edit Query</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Choose different metics <linkText>Edit Query</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Changing the time range is as easy as selecting a different range (such as Past Hour) and clicking Save at the bottom of the blade.
trans-unit.target: Changing the time range is as easy as selecting a different range (such as Past Hour) and clicking Save at the bottom of the blade.

trans-unit.source: You can also choose Custom, which allows you to choose any period of time over the past 2 weeks.
trans-unit.target: You can also choose Custom, which allows you to choose any period of time over the past 2 weeks.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can see the whole two weeks, or, just 1 hour from yesterday.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can see the whole two weeks, or, just 1 hour from yesterday.

trans-unit.source: Type in the text box to enter a different hour.
trans-unit.target: Type in the text box to enter a different hour.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Custom time range</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Custom time range</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Below the time range, you chan choose any number of metrics to show on the chart.
trans-unit.target: Below the time range, you chan choose any number of metrics to show on the chart.

trans-unit.source: When you click Save your changes will be saved for that particular resource.
trans-unit.target: When you click Save your changes will be saved for that particular resource.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have two virtual machines, and you change a chart on one, it will not impact the other.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have two virtual machines, and you change a chart on one, it will not impact the other.

trans-unit.source: With the powerful customization in the portal you can add as many charts as you want.
trans-unit.target: With the powerful customization in the portal you can add as many charts as you want.

trans-unit.source: In the ... menu at the top of the blade click Add tiles: Add Menu
trans-unit.target: In the ... menu at the top of the blade click Add tiles: Add Menu

trans-unit.source: Then, you can select select a chart from the Gallery on the right side of your screen: Gallery
trans-unit.target: Then, you can select select a chart from the Gallery on the right side of your screen: Gallery

trans-unit.source: If you don't see the metric you want, you can always add one of the preset metrics, and Edit the chart to show the metric that you need.
trans-unit.target: If you don't see the metric you want, you can always add one of the preset metrics, and Edit the chart to show the metric that you need.

trans-unit.source: Most metrics show you trends over time, but certain data, like usage quotas, are point-in-time information with a threshold.
trans-unit.target: Most metrics show you trends over time, but certain data, like usage quotas, are point-in-time information with a threshold.

trans-unit.source: You can also see usage quotas on the blade for resources that have quotas:
trans-unit.target: You can also see usage quotas on the blade for resources that have quotas:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Usage</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Usage</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Like with metrics, you can use the <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title> to access the full set of usage quotas programmatically.
trans-unit.target: Like with metrics, you can use the <linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title> to access the full set of usage quotas programmatically.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Receive alert notifications</linkText><title></title> whenever a metric crosses a threshold.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Receive alert notifications</linkText><title></title> whenever a metric crosses a threshold.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable monitoring and diagnostics</linkText><title></title> to collect detailed high-frequency metrics on your service.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable monitoring and diagnostics</linkText><title></title> to collect detailed high-frequency metrics on your service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale instance count automatically</linkText><title></title> to make sure your service is available and responsive.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale instance count automatically</linkText><title></title> to make sure your service is available and responsive.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Monitor application performance</linkText><title></title> if you want to understand exactly how your code is performing in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Monitor application performance</linkText><title></title> if you want to understand exactly how your code is performing in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Use <linkText>Application Insights for JavaScript apps and web pages</linkText><title></title> to get client analytics about the browsers that visit a web page.
trans-unit.target: Use <linkText>Application Insights for JavaScript apps and web pages</linkText><title></title> to get client analytics about the browsers that visit a web page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Monitor availability and responsiveness of any web page</linkText><title></title> with Application Insights so you can find out if your page is down.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Monitor availability and responsiveness of any web page</linkText><title></title> with Application Insights so you can find out if your page is down.
